basics.name: Nicole Smith-Vaniz
basics.label: Student at Tulane University
basics.summary: Passionate and proactive, I'm driven to tackle challenges head-on. I actively seek opportunities to contribute to projects that push boundaries, particularly those that leverage machine learning to enhance health outcomes. Through my writing, I hope to support efforts toward a future that uses the power of technology as a bridge to extend quality healthcare to all.

work.name: Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine
summary: Assistant in conducting a discourse analysis of abortion and abortion law in Louisiana. Analyze thematic shifts from pre-Dobbs era through social listening and comparison of human-determined sentiment to AI-analyzed sentiment

work.name: Tinas Wish
summary: Develop and advance strategies to market the EmpowerU podcast. Analyze educational social platforms to improve outreach strategies. Communicate with other non-profit and educational organizations to establish partnerships.

work.name: The Sexual Health Alliance
summary: Write engaging, well-researched, and celebratory articles for the SHA blog Nymphomedia and Respark Therapy blog.

work.name: GLASS Boston
summary: Initiate, develop, and guide online health education training programs with engaging, informative workshops. Research and compile resource documentation for GLASS's website. Inform and produce marketing content for various social media profiles.

work.name: instED
summary: Create streamlined user facing documentation process through innovative AI-driven automation, transforming release information into dynamic content for enhanced user experience. Review development and design stories in Jira and Confluence and convert them into user facing Help and FAQ documents. Compile end-user input and develop business requirement documentation for technical development. Interface with internal sales, operational, and clinical teams, as well as clients i.e. external clinical teams and patients.

work.name: Hudson Board of Health
summary: Create and manage the social media presence for the MWFC, while maintaining an existing website. Update Monthly Food Access Calendars using Google Calendar and disseminate them throughout local communities.

work.name: Motto Health
summary: Conduct comprehensive research and craft a strategic activation document and presentation for the CEO, providing valuable insights in driving the conversion of providers into strategic partners. Drive patient acquisition through an outbound referral network development campaign. Manage outbound calls to assigned physiciansâ€™ offices and other healthcare providers within a CRM database. Follow-up with interested providers to further develop business relationships.

work.name: Dassault Systemes
summary: Specialize in content creation, composing 60+ posts on professional socials such as Twitter and LinkedIn. Create 50+ competitive social analyses, coverage summaries, promotional emails, and landing page descriptions.

work.name: TheSocialTalks
summary: Research and write about contemporary public health issues and policies such as gun laws, reversal of Roe V. Wade, sexual violence, and more. Publish 2-3 articles weekly.
Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.

education.institution: Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine
courses: Contemporary Challenges in Global Health, Foundations of Health Care Systems, The Cell, Individual & The Community, Foundations of Epidemiology, Infectious Diseases, Introduction to Nutrition

projects.name: Projects with Louisiana State University Health Sciences Center New Orleans
projects.summary: Comprehensive research on Asperger's classification, encompassing historical analysis, literature review, and critical evaluation of studies delineating its distinctions from the autism spectrum, culminating in the proposal of an AI diagnostic experiment to identify defining characteristics and thresholds for distinguishing Asperger's from autism
